intro: Erodendrum ligulifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eremoblast, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Erodendrum ligulifolium is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
